item.title: Relax on the Beach with Elizabeth Hargrave's Newest Game, Sanibel
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/relax-on-beach-with-elizabeth-hargraves-newest-game-sanibel

Elizabeth Hargrave is working on a new board game. The same creative mind behind the acclaimed Wingspan and the environmentally minded Undergrove is working on a mild game about exploring a beach called Sanibel.

The Sanibel Board Game Announcement

According to an official press release, Sanibel is a laid-back tile placement board game inspired by summer days on the beach, hunting for shells. Players can explore the shore, putting seashells into a bag and earning points on how they are arranged in the bag. You can also earn points by observing the waves crashing into the shoreline and exploring a nearby lighthouse.

At the end of the game, each player will have a collage of beautiful watercolor shells, sand dollars, and shark teeth. Whoever has the most points by the end of their trek on the beach is considered the winner.

Sanibel is a cozy, meditative game. One that offers a combination of strategy and and atmosphere for both board gamers, ocean-lovers, and everyone else between. It is similar to journey-focused board game experiences like Tokaido or American Tabletop Awards 2025 Strategy Game winner, Let's Go to Japan.

Overall, Sanibel is a modest continuation of Elizabeth Hargrave's catalog of board games showcasing her love of nature. Wingspan was a game about managing a bird sanctuary, a premise so evocative it got two spin-offs: Wyrmspan and Finspan. Hargrave's follow-up, Undergrove, was an insightful experience about mycorhizas, or symbiotic networks of seeds and fungi, in the American Pacific Northwest.

Another of Hargrave's games, Tussie Mussie, is a card game based on Victorian flower languages. It is an I-Split-You-Choose experience where you draw cards with flowers on them and combine them into appealing arrangements. Certain arrangements would earn points based on their composition, using real-world flowers like peonies and orchids.

The Sanibel board game is set to come out some time in early 2026 at an MSRP of $39.99.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. Thisâ€¦ More about Tyler
